title: Truncal valve repair using autologous pericardial patch augmentation.
abstract: A 35-month-old boy with severe truncal valve regurgitation underwent successful repair by tricuspidization using raphe slicing and an extension technique with glutaraldehyde-treated autologous pericardium. His truncal valve regurgitation improved from severe to mild 5 years postoperatively. Tricuspidization using raphe slicing and valve extension with autologous pericardium might be one of the alternatives for truncal valve regurgitation with a quadricuspid valve.
categories: Congenital Hereditary and Neonatal Diseases and Abnormalities
